page.title: 03Flora and fauna
page.content: The area is dominated by farmland.On the edges of the fields there are roses and hawthorns,poppies,cow parsley and thistles.Many different grasses grow along the road sides.In the meadows by the river grasses,speedwell,clovers and nettles grow.By the ponds yellow Irises and frog-bitt were most common.In the woods different ferns and grasses grow in the shade. Badgers and Hares live in the wild places on farm land.Mice and pigeons live there to feed off the crops and seeds.Red legged partriges roam round the fields. We found Dragonflies,Toads,Frogs in damp places in the meadow. There are water birds on the river and banks.On the top of the ponds pond skaters live. In the quiet of the woods the grey squirrels lives with the bullfinch and coal tit.
